New Records: Saurabh Netravalkar took four wickets and conceded only 18 runs in his four overs.
Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma, two of India's top batsmen, were dismissed cheaply.
Key Match Events: The U.S. set a target of 110 but saw it chased down with 10 balls to spare.
Nitish Kumar and Steven Taylor put on a key 31-run partnership.
The match had a turning point with a superb catch by Mohammed Siraj to dismiss Nitish Kumar.
The U.S. were penalized five runs for failing three times to start the new over within a minute.
India took full control after a costly drop by Netravalkar.
Pre-Game Insights: The U.S. had previously shocked Pakistan with a super-over victory.
India won the toss and chose to bowl first, setting the U.S. a target of 110.
The match was highly anticipated against a No 1-ranked team.
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Jones expressed frustration but acknowledged the team's performance.
Saurabh Netravalkar's drop of Suryakumar Yadav was a costly error.
The U.S. still has a chance to qualify for the next round with a win against Ireland.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at Lauderhill, with heavy rain expected in upcoming matches.
The U.S. will face Ireland on June 14, with the match's start time at 10:30am ET.
The tournament's key dates include the Super Eight stage and semi-finals.
